definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: The miraculous effect of medical herbs has raised some conservative eyebrows.
sentences.chinese: 草药的奇效简直使一些思想保守的人瞠目结舌。

sentences.english: A house full of jade and gold is hard to protect.
sentences.chinese: 满堂金玉，没有人能长久保守。

sentences.english: The cold stone of the mysterious obelisk guards its secrets.
sentences.chinese: 神秘方尖塔上的冰冷岩石保守着它的秘密。

sentences.english: Note: the heat shock consensus sequences are indicated by underscores.
sentences.chinese: 下划线表示热激保守序列。

sentences.english: Growing restriction of the range of public information under the pressure of military secrecy.
sentences.chinese: 以保守军事机密为由对公众信息越来越多的限制。

sentences.english: Over time, the more aggressive neocomms may come to dominate.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的推移，更有闯劲的新保守派可能成为主导。

sentences.english: In addition, the design of labyrinth and the two protection doors in cyclotron rooms were conservative.
sentences.chinese: 回旋加速器室两道防护门和迷道长度的设计是保守的。

sentences.english: He’s quiet and reflective, and he dresses conservatively.
sentences.chinese: 他为人安静内敛，穿着保守。

sentences.english: As the recession deepens, Barbie’s conservative values are also back in vogue.
sentences.chinese: 随经济萧条恶化，芭比娃娃的保守价值也重振雄风。

sentences.english: In this grass-roots setting, her conservative political views came into focus.
sentences.chinese: 就在这样的基层里，她的保守的政治观点开始形成。

sentences.english: You can make money if you put your savings into conservative investments.
sentences.chinese: 用积蓄进行保守性投资的话，你会赚钱的。

sentences.english: The liberal candidate was accused by his conservation opponent of being a bleeding heart on welfare issues.
sentences.chinese: 自由派候选人在福利问题上被保守派对手斥为老好人。

sentences.english: Why is it necessary to keep so much about Palpatine a mystery?
sentences.chinese: 为什么有必要对关于帕尔帕汀的这么多事情保守秘密？

sentences.english: Southern conservatives did openly challenge the constitutionality of such legislation.
sentences.chinese: 南方保守派公开挑战如此立法是否符合宪法精神。

sentences.english: It's coated with a stronger sense of not showing too much skin for a more conservative beauty.
sentences.chinese: 它涂上了较为保守的美没有表现出太多的皮肤感更强。

sentences.english: But the Sino-Japanese War after the increasingly conservative in their thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 但甲午战争以后，其思想日趋保守。

definition: to incline to/to prefer/to be prone to
always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
